messages: d4055aa476f1a5a463d819918f8d7e01 (19:12): why does onload="alert(a)" not do anything when I slap it on an <input> tag?
d4055aa476f1a5a463d819918f8d7e01 (19:13): onload="alert('a')"
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:13): rutski89: There is no onload attribute for <input> elements in HTML
d4055aa476f1a5a463d819918f8d7e01 (19:13): Dorward: hmm... i see
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:13): rutski89: <input><script type="text/javascript">window.alert('a');</script>
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:13): Inputs are replaced, but they aren't replaced by other content, just a widget
d4055aa476f1a5a463d819918f8d7e01 (19:14): Dorward: where where is the best place to put an auto focus for an input
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:14): rutski89: Best is something of a matter of opinion. My opinion is that the best place is in the bin.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:14): rutski89 set its tabindex to 0
d4055aa476f1a5a463d819918f8d7e01 (19:14): StaZ[work]: tabindex?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:14): rutski89: garbage, trash can, waste disposal
d4055aa476f1a5a463d819918f8d7e01 (19:15): Dorward: if google got rid of their auto focus I'd bet you would be pretty pissed off: http://www.google.com/
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:15): rutski89: No, I wouldn't
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:15): rutski89: You go to google.com?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:15): I search from my address bar.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:16): Firefox has a google search bar in the tool bar :D
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:16): how i love that
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:17): Bleh, that's too many steps too. FF's quick searches are faster.
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:17): <script language=javascript>
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:17): window.iframe1.GetElementByName("vb_login_username").value="gggg";
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:17): window.iframe1.GetElementByName("vb_login_password").value="";
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:17): what's wrong in here?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:18): Don't paste in the channel.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:18): you psting in the channel is the first thing wrong
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:18): I didnt notice it
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:18): Nissim first, <script language="text/javascript">

8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (19:18): Nissim: You are using the deprecated language attribute, you aren't using the required type attribute, you are commenting out your script, you are using frames, you are calling "GetElementByName" which doesn't exist as a method of any standard object in JS or DOM.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:19): secundo, GetElementByName doesn't exist, it's getElementsByName or getElementById       it's case sensivite
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:19): getElementsByName will work? because I have no id for it.. and no name for the form
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:19): good job Sherlock :)
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:20): Nissim names aren't unique, IDs are
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:20): Nissim: You're being vague.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:20): What is "it"? What has what attributes? Can you change it?
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:20): Nissim your form needs a name
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:20): StaZ[work]: Absolutely not.
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:20): I cant use a name, I cant change that code..
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:21): b0at do you have an idea maybe?
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:21): b0at for javascript accessing it doesn't need a name?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:21): By "that code" I take it you mean the markup, not the script.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:21): StaZ[work]: Absolutely not.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:21): You use ids to uniquely identify any element in general.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:21): b0at si you access form with document.forms[0] ?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:21): Nissim: No. You've not provided a clear picture of your markup. Use the pastebot to clarify.
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:22): window.iframe1.forms[0].vb_login_username.value = "gggg"; will work?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:22): Grabbing an element by position isn't very convenient.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:22): how do you access your form/form element if the form doesn't have a name, you get all elements by their ID ?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:23): StaZ[work]: Nothing needs a name but inputs.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:23): tabarnack
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:23): mange dla marde
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:24): b0at next time you try to platy the "i know everything" guy, try to explain the reason of what you state
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:25): Stop being an idiot for a second and realize that I might be lagged here.
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:26): ok, so how do I access form[1].somename.value?
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:26): in the iframe of course
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:29): window.iframe1.document.forms[0].vb_login_username.value = "gggg";
a948b325545ea9c13a3139b2629fb381 (19:29): please please please help me

132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:33): Nissim give your form a name, i don't care what boat says a form needs a name, then window.iframe1.document.forms["formname"].vb_login_username.value = "gggg";
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:35): StaZ[work] the id is also indexed in document.forms, so what it doesnt need is a name
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:36): also indexed? both name and ID appear as elements of the forms collection?
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:36): yes
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:37): oh that i didn't know... thank you
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:37): b0at you could've said that in the first place
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:38): Use DOM methods and all this confusion is gone.
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:38): i asked twice how you access form elements and you never answered

7dd1269592c80e8d5a87f2931a35a2d1 (19:38): i'm doing someAnchor.onclick = function(event){ ... return false; }; ..but that doesn't stop the browser from loading the href like it does in onclick="... return false;" ... anyone know what to do here?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:38): And you never stopped typing, either
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:39): yeah right
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:40): mirzapirza you want to override the event? as long as you assign the new value after the dom has finished parsing you should be fine
7dd1269592c80e8d5a87f2931a35a2d1 (19:43): oh, duh, i wasn't setting it at all, because i changed the className.. sorry. thanks though, that made me look again
